quote: It was a long day, but we worked well together. I'm happy to feel strong on the bike again and come away with the win
I'm really disappointed, it's been a long time since I've been in a position to win a Faces event. I gave everything, but today wasn't my day.

You need the team to disrupt the chase and help you maintain a gap. Without them, the bunch can catch you much faster. There wasn't as much tar this year, which made it easier to control the gap. The gravel and climbing sections were tough, but they broke up the rhythm of the bunch.
Scenery was indescribable but the route was super tough to say the least - a hard day in the saddle!
What an awesome race. The organising of the race was so well done. The arrival at the start, the markings of the course, the marshals along the way, very professionally done.
Unbelievably well organised, Incredible scenery and a 'bucket list' event. Compliments to every marshal and water point personal, thumbs up to a great race.
Entered, I have a score to settle with this race... last time I got sick and was basically pushed home for the last 20km.

Dont get carried away on the first half, second half has some sting

As already mentioned the first half is easy, mostly flat with some downhill and no climbs and with this one tends to going all out. The second half do have more climbs and uphill drags and if you have wasted most of the energy on the first half the second half will be a long ride with no power.
